channel.title: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs
channel.description:
ive been trying to make one of my logs to post on a site in the same topic ive tested it out a few times trying to get it to work but i couldnt do it
[code]writeTemp("URGENT: " + playerName + " reported " + receivedPlayerName + ", RULEBREAK: " + rule+"", (new URL("http://sitegoes here", true"))); [/code]
ive tried to take out some ) w\e their called but that didnt work either this is the error i get everytime i do take one out or add one in
[code]client.java:14031: unclosed string literal writeTemp("URGENT: " + playerName + " reported " + receivedPlayerName + ", RULEB REAK: " + rule+"", (new URL("http://sitehere", true")));
^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
i also have [code]import java.net.URL;[/code] added any help or ideas? i took out my site so i wont advertise

item.title: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

nhm that doesnt work either
i used a regular bufferedwriter but that just gave me more errors

Read full topic
item.source: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs

item.title: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

writeTemp("URGENT: " + playerName + " reported " + receivedPlayerName + ", RULEBREAK: " + rule, (new URL(“http://sitegoes here”)));

Try that. Not too sure if a FileWriter can write to a website though.

Read full topic
item.source: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs

item.title: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

im useing client class if thats what your asking
im useing this import
import java.net.URL;

and heres the method

public static void writeTemp(String tempData, String tempFile) { try { BufferedWriter LV = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(tempFile, true)); LV.write(tempData); LV.newLine(); LV.flush(); } catch(IOException IOE) {} }

Read full topic

item.title: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

That is because URL does not contain the constructor String,boolean.

So, what class are you using to write to the URL? Post the line your initiating the class you’re using.

Read full topic
item.source: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs

item.title: Load logs to a site? ex: banlogs
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:2, topic:166416”]writeTemp("URGENT: " + playerName + " reported " + receivedPlayerName + ", RULEBREAK: " + rule, (new URL(“http://sitegoes here”, true)));

Try that.[/quote]

diffrent error now

[code]client.java:14004: cannot find symbol
symbol : constructor URL(java.lang.String,boolean)
location: class java.net.URL
writeTemp("URGENT: " + playerName + " reported " + receivedPlayerName + ", RULEB
REAK: " + rule, (new URL(“http://site/index.php/to
pic,216.0.html#post_reports”, true)));

              ^

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

i took out the main site url

Read full topic
